body: Would you write your environment? Thank you!

Quick hack while commenting the concerned migration. Therefore, issue https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1307 seems to reappears. For now, half fix using this modification:

```
diff --git a/backend/api/migrations/0012_auto_20210514_0654.py b/backend/api/migrations/0012_auto_20210514_0654.py
index 5d6f819e..9c6963e0 100644
--- a/backend/api/migrations/0012_auto_20210514_0654.py
+++ b/backend/api/migrations/0012_auto_20210514_0654.py
@@ -185,12 +185,12 @@ class Migration(migrations.Migration):
             name='user',
             field=models.ForeignKey(on_delete=django.db.models.deletion.CASCADE, to=settings.AUTH_USER_MODEL),
         ),
-        migrations.AddField(
-            model_name='comment',
-            name='example',
-            field=models.ForeignKey(default=1, on_delete=django.db.models.deletion.CASCADE, related_name='comments', to='api.example'),
-            preserve_default=False,
-        ),
+        # migrations.AddField(
+        #     model_name='comment',
+        #     name='example',
+        #     field=models.ForeignKey(default=1, on_delete=django.db.models.deletion.CASCADE, related_name='comments', to='api.example'),
+        #     preserve_default=False,
+        # ),
         migrations.AlterUniqueTogether(
             name='category',
             unique_together={('example', 'user', 'label')},
diff --git a/backend/api/views/auto_labeling.py b/backend/api/views/auto_labeling.py
index ae660f79..3ab0c063 100644
--- a/backend/api/views/auto_labeling.py
+++ b/backend/api/views/auto_labeling.py
@@ -2,7 +2,7 @@ import botocore.exceptions
 import requests
 from auto_labeling_pipeline.mappings import MappingTemplate
 from auto_labeling_pipeline.menu import Options
-from auto_labeling_pipeline.models import RequestModelFactory
+from auto_labeling_pipeline.models import RequestModelFactory, RequestModel
 from auto_labeling_pipeline.pipeline import pipeline
 from auto_labeling_pipeline.postprocessing import PostProcessor
 from auto_labeling_pipeline.task import TaskFactory
@@ -21,6 +21,14 @@ from ..permissions import IsInProjectOrAdmin, IsProjectAdmin
 from ..serializers import (AutoLabelingConfigSerializer,
                            get_annotation_serializer)
 
+@classmethod
+def monkey_patched_find(cls, model_name: str): #-> Type[RequestModel]:
+        for subclass in RequestModel.__subclasses__():
+            if subclass.Config.title == model_name:
+                return subclass
+        raise NameError(f'{model_name} is not found.')
+
+RequestModelFactory.find = monkey_patched_find
 
 class AutoLabelingTemplateListAPI(APIView):
     permission_classes = [IsAuthenticated & IsProjectAdmin]
```

However, I still have an Error 400 when I try to create my custom HTTP request, coming from http://localhost:3000/v1/auto-labeling-parameter-testing who might come from the fact than I can't create a GET method request.

@EnzoNclt how did this monkey patch for you work? I ran into the same error as you, used your fix, migrated, and now all comments pages are broken.

Here's what the backend error looks like:


Follow-up, in trying to follow some StackOverflow assistance I ended up in a pattern of deleting the migration row from the postgres, running into more chaining errors about things not existing, and having to pretty much delete all my local postgres DB data because it got borked so badly.

Thankfully I've been testing this all on a local testing deploy, but I'd really rather not deploy with this migration if it's still a problem.

If it never got quite resolved, let me know and I'll reopen an issue here.

I wonder if the culprit is https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/backend/api/migrations/0012_auto_20210514_0654.py#L191

```
default=1
```
If the document/example with id = 1 has been deleted and you migrate, this would break, correct?

I can't find a single other instance in the migrations code where a default is applied to a ForeignKey migration.
